robotPlatform.label: Dingo Omnidirectional
description: Robot Platform - Dingo Omnidirectional
Specifications: An omnidirectional drive mobile robot, Dingo
includes user power breakouts for 5 V, 12 V, and unregulated 12 V
battery voltage. Dingo has a maximum speed of 1.6 m/s with a
payload of 20 kg. The base platform mass includes a computer and a
single battery, and does not addect the 20 kg allowable payload.
Dingo runs on ROS Melodic and Ubuntu Server 18-04. Dingo includes
user-accessible ethernet, wifi, and bluetooth.

panelColours.label: Yellow
description: Colour, side panels - Yellow
Specifications: The Dingo's side panels will be coated yellow.
Note: The default colour is yellow. Optional colours are available
at an increased price and lead-time.

description: Colour, side panels - Black

Note: The default colour is yellow. Optional colours are available
at an increased price and lead-time.

batteryItems.label: Lead Acid
description: Battery - Sealed Lead Acid
Specifications: Includes:
- 1X Dingo PCBA for attaching 1X sealed-lead-acid battery to a Dingo.
- 1X sealed-lead-acid battery at 12V with 18Ah of capacity.
- 1X charger for a sealed-lead-acid battery.
Note: this line requires the purchase of a Dingo robot.

batteryItems.label: Lithium
description: Battery - Lithium
Specifications: Includes:
- 1X Dingo PCBA for attaching 6X lithium batteries to Dingo.
- 6X lithium batteries at 14.4V with 6.8Ah of capacity (40.8Ah total).
- 1X charger for lithium batteries. This can charge 4X batteries at a time.

tower.label: No
description: COMMENT - skip this line for structuring purposes
Empty line item

tower.label: Yes
description: COMMENT - skip this line for structuring purposes
The robot will include a tower bracket for additional attachments.
This bracket will be made of aluminum, and will include steel or
stainless-steel fasteners. The tower bracket will be included in the
robot's URDF.

attachmentItems.label: None
description: COMMENT - skip this line for structuring purposes
Empty line item

attachmentItems.label: Velodyne, Low
description: COMMENT - skip this line for structuring purposes
This attachment position will include a Velodyne Puck. The Velodyne Puck has:
- a 100 m range
- a 360° horizontal field-of-view
- a ±15° vertical FOV
- an accuracy of ±30 mm
This sensor will be adequately powered from the robot, will be connected
to the robot's computer through ethernet, and will be attached to the robot
with metal fasteners.

attachmentItems.label: Velodyne, Mid
description: COMMENT - skip this line for structuring purposes
This attachment position will include a Velodyne Puck. The Velodyne Puck has:
- a 100 m range
- a 360° horizontal field-of-view
- a ±15° vertical FOV
- an accuracy of ±30 mm
This sensor will be adequately powered from the robot, will be connected
to the robot's computer through ethernet, and will be attached to the robot
with metal fasteners on a 40 mm tall bracket.

attachmentItems.label: Velodyne, High
description: COMMENT - skip this line for structuring purposes
This attachment position will include a Velodyne Puck. The Velodyne Puck has:
- a 100 m range
- a 360° horizontal field-of-view
- a ±15° vertical FOV
- an accuracy of ±30 mm
This sensor will be adequately powered from the robot, will be connected
to the robot's computer through ethernet, and will be attached to the robot
with metal fasteners on a 80 mm tall bracket.

attachmentItems.label: Hokuyo
description: COMMENT - skip this line for structuring purposes
This attachment position will include a Hokuyo UST-10LX. The Hokuyo has:
- a 10 m range
- a 270° horizontal field-of-view
- a resolution of 0.25°
This sensor will be adequately powered from the robot, will be connected
to the robot's computer through ethernet, and will be attached to the robot
with metal fasteners.

attachmentItems.label: Microstain
description: COMMENT - skip this line for structuring purposes
This attachment position will include a Microstrain 3DM-GX5-25. The sensor has:
- a triaxial accelerometer with ±8 g acceleration range
- a triaxial gyroscope with ±300°/second gyro range
- a repeatability of 0.2°
This sensor will be connected to the robot's computer through USB.
The sensor will be attached to the robot with metal fasteners.

kits.label: IndoorNav

one._comment: attachmentItem should be an integer, matching the index of the item

three._comment: attachmentItem should be an integer, matching the index of the item

four._comment: attachmentItem should be an integer, matching the index of the item

descriptionHardware: Specifications: This kit includes 2X Hokuyo LiDAR and 1X Microstrain AHRS,
Note: this kit does not include a computer or the robot platform.
descriptionSoftware: - a closed-source copy of the IndoorNav autonomy software
- sensor drivers and networking on the robot's computer
- URDF configuration on the robot's computer to include sensor postitions
Note: this software requires the purchase of the related hardware kit.
